metadata.key_specifications: Stabilized output current of 10 mA, high current accuracy at supply voltage variation, small SOT23 package, qualified for automotive applications (AEC-Q101)
metadata.applications: Constant current LED driver, generic constant current source, automotive applications

page_summaries.content:
1. General description
LED driver consisting of a resistor-equipped PNP transistor with two diodes on one chip in a small SOT23 plastic package.

2. Features and benefits
• Stabilized output current of 10 mA
• High currrent accuracy at supply voltage variation
• Reduces component count and board space
• Qualified according to AEC-Q101

3. Applications
• Constant current LED driver
• Generic constant current source
• Automotive applications

Product Summary.content: LED driver consisting of a resistor-equipped PNP transistor with two diodes on one chip in a small SOT23 plastic package. It provides a stabilized output current of 10 mA with high current accuracy at supply voltage variation. The device reduces component count and board space, and is qualified according to AEC-Q101 for automotive applications.

The LED driver is suitable for constant current LED driving, generic constant current source applications, and automotive applications. It features a typical output current of 10 mA with a minimum of 8.5 mA and a maximum of 11.5 mA under specific conditions (VSUP = 10 V, VO = 8.6 V, Tamb = 25 °C, pulsed operation with tp ≤ 300 µs and δ ≤ 0.02).

The LED driver operates with a supply voltage (VSUP) of up to 18 V. It is designed to provide a constant current source with high accuracy and stability, while reducing component count and board space requirements in automotive and other applications.

This chunk provides detailed package outline dimensions for the TO-236AB (SOT23) package, which is a common surface-mount package used for various electronic components.

Package outline dimensions and application circuit diagrams are crucial information found in datasheets for electronic components. The application circuit diagram illustrates how the component can be used in a practical circuit, while the package outline dimensions are necessary for PCB layout and mechanical integration.

Reliability and Environmental Conditions.content: 8. Limiting values: This section provides information about the absolute maximum ratings and limiting conditions for the device, such as supply voltage, output voltage, reverse voltage, power dissipation, junction temperature, ambient temperature, and storage temperature. These limits must not be exceeded to ensure reliable operation and prevent permanent damage to the device.

Table 5. Limiting values: This table lists the specific limiting values for various parameters under certain conditions. It includes the minimum and maximum values for supply voltage, output voltage, reverse voltage, total power dissipation (with different conditions), junction temperature, ambient temperature, and storage temperature.

Footnotes: The footnotes provide additional details and clarifications related to the limiting values. [1] specifies that the reverse voltage limit applies between all terminals. [2] and [3] provide the conditions for the total power dissipation limits, such as the PCB material, copper layer, and mounting pad size.

This section is crucial for understanding the safe operating conditions and environmental specifications of the device. It helps ensure reliable operation by adhering to the specified limits and avoiding potential damage or degradation caused by exceeding these limits.
